title: Microsoft Access 2013 - Advanced Master Databases
headline: Learn Advanced Microsoft Access 2013 and take your database skills to the next level with this free online course.
description: This free online Microsoft Access 2013 advanced course, designed for intermediate users will teach you about using master databases. In this course you will learn about Indexes and Movies Database and cover topics that discuss the Datasheet View, Controlling the Display, Advanced Sorting, and Filtering. With this course, you will learn advanced techniques that will help you supercharge your MS Access and database skills.

courseDescription:
In modern businesses data management skills and database development skills are in great demand. If you’ve already taken our basic Microsoft Access 2013 course, or know your way around the program already, then you’re ready for our Microsoft Access 2013 Advanced course. Get ready to become a data management expert as this class takes your skills to the next level.

Your expert trainer will show you how to use macros, tables, forms, queries, and other tools to create a professional, working database. Follow along as you learn to create and maintain macros, then see how to effectively link to other data sources. Get helpful techniques that allow you to link, report, and package your data quickly, and find out how to split a database by splitting the frontend and backend.

In the Microsoft Access 2013 Advanced video training course, you’ll take your knowledge up a notch as you get acquainted with Microsoft Access 2013’s most sophisticated features. If you think you know all there is to know about Access 2013 then think again, as this course goes way beyond the basics, giving you the knowledge of all of the best Access tips and tricks. Start this course today and you’ll learn the skills you need to make an impact with sleek, high-performing databases that help you do your job better.

Should you need refresh your understanding of SQL queries you can look at out Introduction to Transact-SQL course, which details and expalins much of Microsofts SQL Transact.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about Indexes and be introduced to the Movies Database, and it covers topics such as working with Datasheet View, Controlling the Display and Advanced Sorting, and Filtering in Datasheet View.
topics: Introduction, Indexes and Datasheet View - Learning Outcomes
Prerequisites and Basic Knowledge of Access 2013
Indexes and Introduction to the Movies Database
Basics in Working with Datasheet View
Controlling the Display and Advanced Sorting and Filtering in Datasheet View
Introduction, Indexes and Datasheet View - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Linking Database Tables and ODBC & SQL Server
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about Linking Database Tables and ODBC & SQL Server , and it covers topics such as Linking to Other Access Database Tables, Installing SQL Server Express, Setting up a Database, Accessing MDF file, and Linking via ODBC using SQL Server.
topics: Linking Database Tables and ODBC & SQL Server - Learning Outcomes
Linking to Other Access Database Tables
How to Install SQL Server Express
Setting up a Database, Accessing MDF file, and Linking via ODBC using SQL Server
Linking Database Tables and ODBC & SQL Server - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Splitting an Access Database and Access Options
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about Splitting an Access Database and Access Options, and it covers topics such as Reasons to Split a Database; Splitting a Database to a Front-end and a Back-end; Consequences of the Split; Moving a Database; Adding a Trusted Location; Access Options relating to Multi-user Issues; and Record Locking.
topics: Splitting an Access Database and Access Options - Learning Outcomes
Reasons to Split a Database; Splitting a Database to a Front-end and a Back-end
Consequences of the Split; Moving a Database; Adding a Trusted Location
Access Options relating to Multi-user Issues; Record Locking
Splitting an Access Database and Access Options - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about Macros, and it covers topics such as Basics of Macros and Properties of Macro Editor, Examples of Macros; Autoexec, Macro Security, Customizing the Quick Access Toolbar and the Ribbon.
topics: Macros - Learning Outcomes
Basics of Macros and Properties of Macro Editor
Examples of Macros; Autoexec
More Autoexec
Macro Security
Customizing the Quick Access Toolbar and the Ribbon

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about Visual Basic for Applications, and it covers topics such as Convert Macro to VBA; VBA Editor Reorganizing VBA Workspace; Developing, Debugging and Running VBA Codes; Modules, Subs, Options Explicit, and Variables; Scope of Variables; and Branch and Loop.

modules.name: Module
topics: Microsoft Access 2013 - Advanced. Master Databases Course Assessment

slides:
• Upon successful completion of this module you will be able to:
    • Discuss the purpose and cost of indexing a field in a table in Access.
    • Identify how to setup and use an index in your Access Database.
    • Discuss the uses and features of Datasheet View in Access 2013. 
    • Recognize how to open and use a template database provided by Microsoft.
    • Identify how to apply text formatting to your table records in Access 2013.
    • Recognize how to use filter by Selection, and filter by Form.

• Prerequisites and Basic Knowledge of Access 2013

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Indexes and Introduction to the Movies Database

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Basics in Working with Datasheet View

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Controlling the Display and Advanced Sorting and Filtering in Datasheet View

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Having studied this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the purpose and cost of indexing a field in a table in Access.
    • Identify how to setup and use an index in your Access Database.
    • Discuss the uses and features of Datasheet View in Access 2013.
    • Recognize how to open and use a template database provided by Microsoft.
    • Identify how to apply text formatting to your table records in Access 2013.
    • Recognize how to use filter by Selection, and filter by Form.

• Upon successful completion of this module you will be able to:
    • Identify how to import and link data from a database into a new database.
    • Identify how to install and setup SQL Server.
    • Discuss setting up a database on a SQL server.
    • Discuss connecting an Access database to a SQL server.

• Linking to Other Access Database Tables

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• How to Install SQL Server Express

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Setting up a Database, Accessing MDF file, and Linking via ODBC using SQL Server

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Having studied this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify how to import and link data from a database into a new database.
    • Identify how to install and setup SQL Server.
    • Discuss setting up a database on a SQL server.
    • Discuss connecting an Access database to a SQL server.

• Upon successful completion of this module you will be able to:
    • Recognize how to split a database in Access.
    • Identify how re-establish a connection or link to tables that file location has been changed.
    • Recognize how to add a trusted location from PC/network to your database.
    • Define the purpose of record locking in Access.

• Reasons to Split a Database; Splitting a Database to a Front-end and a Back-end

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Consequences of the Split; Moving a Database; Adding a Trusted Location

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Access Options relating to Multi-user Issues; Record Locking

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

• Having studied this module, you should be able to:
    • Recognize how to split a database in Access.
    • Identify how re-establish a connection or link to tables that file location has been changed.
    • Recognize how to add a trusted location from PC/network to your database.
    • Define the purpose of record locking in Access.

• Upon successful completion of this module you should be able to:
    • Discuss the basics of macros, what they are, and what they do.
    • Recognize how to create a basic Macro and run it.
    • Identify how to associate events with form controls such as buttons.
    • Discuss the capabilities and uses of an Autoexec Macro.
    • Discuss the security risk of macros, and the trust centre in Access.
    • Identify how you can change and customise the Ribbon.

• Basics of Macros and Properties of Macro Editor

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

    • Recognize how to create a basic Macro and run it.
    • Identify how to associate events with form controls such as buttons.
    • Discuss the capabilities and uses of an Autoexec Macro.
    • Discuss the security risk of macros, and the trust centre in Access.
    • Identify how you can change and customise the Ribbon.

• Upon successful completion of this module you will be able to:
    • Identify how to convert a Macro to VBA code.
    • Recognize the layout and know how to navigate the VBA Workspace.
    • Recognize how to write comment in VBA code.
    • Identify how to debug and step through your VBA code step by step.
    • Discuss creating VBA module in Access.
    • Recognize how to create and declare variables in VBA.
    • Discuss the concepts and principles of using variables in VBA.
    • Identify how to create conditional statements, and selection statements in VBA.
    • Identify how to create a Loop in VBA.
